full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 749 Filed 08/10/22 Page 229 of 236 1133
LC3Cmax7 Dawson - cross
1 isn't it?
2 A. Yes.
3 Q. And he also told you that he opened the briefcase again when he got inside, and this time he removed $5,600 in $100 bills from a white envelope, isn't that what he told you?
4
5 A. Yes.
6
7 Q. Again he told you that he left through the glass door and drove away, he told you that, didn't he?
8
9 A. Yes.
10 Q. And finally, Juan Alessi told you that he needed the money in order to pay for his girlfriend's immigration papers, isn't that what he told you?
11
12 A. Yes.
13
14 Q. Thank you. You can put that down now, Sergeant Dawson.
15 THE COURT: We're done for the night.
16 MR. EVERDELL: This is a good stopping place.
17 THE COURT: Members of the jury -- everybody be seated. I want to take a minute.
18
19 It's been one week, so this is our first weekend apart. So I really want to just really emphasize, all of my instructions and rules continue to apply and apply in full force for the weekend. So no looking at, reading, or any kind of consumption of any media involved in the case, any kind of communication involving the case or the like, of course. And keep an open mind and all my other instructions. So please
20
21

23

25 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00012743
